title: Week with MacBook Pro 16"! I LOVE IT!
description: PLEASE SUBSCRIBE:  GET MY PINK iJUSTINE CABLES HERE:   GET MY EDITING PLUGIN:    MUSIC I USE -   FRIEND ME HERE:        MY NEW PROJECT:   PODCAST:       WHAT I USE TO MAKE VIDEOS    CAMERAS: Sony a7 IV -  Sony a1 -   Sony a7s III -   Insta 360 ONE X3 -  Insta 360 ONE RS -  Insta 360 GO2 -   LENSES: New Sony GM 24-70mm ii -  Older Sony GM 24-70mm -  New Sony Sony 20-70mm -  Sony GM 16-35mm -  Sony GM 50mm -  Sony GM 135mm -  Sony GM 85mm -   AUDIO:  Sennheiser AVX Digital Wireless -  Sony XLR Adapter -  Sony Hot Shoe Shotgun -  Tiny Sony Microphone -  DJI Mics -  Rode Podcaster Pro II -  Podcaster Mic -  Elgato Wave 3 Mic -   DRONES: DJI Mavic 3 -  DJI Mini 3 -  DJI Air 2S -   LIGHTING: Aputure 600d Pro -  Aputure Light Dome II -  Aputure Amaran 200d -  Aputure 35in Light Dome -  Aputure Lantern Softbox -   Sony CF Express A 160g + Card Reader-  Sony CF Express A 800g -     These links are affiliate and by using them youre helping out my channel! Thank you!     BECOME A CHANNEL MEMBER:
transcript: (upbeat music) - 16-inch MacBook Pro, here it is. So I've already made a video kind of talking about it a little bit. The unboxing. But now here we are, over a week later, and I wanna say that this has completely replaced my iMac because I'm still using it 'cause I have projects that are already saved on it, but for the most part I've almost entirely moved everything over to the MacBook. When I was talking before about my editing process and my workflow, everything pretty much ran through portable hard drives, and that is because I would be traveling a lot, so I would be editing on my iMac. I would just take that drive when I leave and continue editing on my MacBook. Something else that happened this week with this MacBook was I took part in an editing challenge. It was a Mac verse PC editing challenge with Linus Tech Tips. I'm sure some of you guys are familiar with him, but one of his editors, Taran, he edits on a PC in Adobe Premiere and he has all of these crazy keyboards and macros and shortcuts. He's an extremely, extremely talented editor, so this was a really fun challenge to do. That was really stressful for me because it was one of the first times that I felt like I was really being pressured. We had four hours to create this video, so during that time I was definitely pushing this thing to its limits. Thankfully, this was only a one-camera shoot with some extra B rolls so it wasn't too intensive, but a lot of times, videos like this, I'm using all 4K footage shot directly from the A73's, and I'm editing in a multi-cam timeline, just like this. And it's fast. I just can't stress enough, I mean, yeah, this thing now has 64 gigs of RAM, it better be freaking fast. I normally would completely spec them out just because yes, I'm crazy, and this is what I choose to spend all of my money on. This computer now is replacing the 15-inch MacBook Pro. But I like to have access to everything when I'm editing and I like to be able to see everything. I'm able to have a larger viewer here, so I'm able to see also more of my timeline, so that's already made a huge difference. And then let's talk about the hard drive. I mean, I guess maybe I haven't been looking in the $2,000 range, so maybe that's the reason why. The RAM also starts at 16 gigs, which is so incredible.
